title: 107_hr542
content: The Act may be cited as the "Small Business Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999". The Congress finds that a vibrant small business sector is crucial for job creation in the economy, with small businesses facing a disproportionate share of regulatory burdens. Federal agencies must consider the impact of regulations on small businesses early in the rulemaking process. The Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process has been effective in allowing small businesses to participate in developing rules by the EPA and OSHA. The Act aims to provide a forum for effective small business participation. The Fairness Act of 1996 has enabled small businesses to participate in developing rules by the EPA and OSHA. Its purposes include providing a forum for small business participation and expanding the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process. SEC. 3. ENSURING FULL ANALYSIS OF POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON SMALL ENTITIES OF RULES PROPOSED BY CERTAIN AGENCIES. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes providing information on the potential impacts of the proposed rule on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives within 30 days. The covered agencies must notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis, including information on potential impacts on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives within 30 days. Subsequently, a review panel consisting of full-time Federal employees will be convened to assess the draft proposed rule. The covered agency must convene a review panel, consisting of full-time Federal employees, to assess the draft proposed rule and gather advice from small entity representatives on specific issues related to regulatory analysis. The covered agency must convene a review panel of full-time Federal employees to gather advice from small entity representatives on specific issues related to regulatory analysis. The review panel must report to the agency head within 60 days on comments received and findings on certain regulatory issues. The covered agency convenes a review panel to report on comments from small entity representatives and findings on regulatory issues. The agency head must publish the panel's report in the Federal Register within 120 days or as part of the proposed rulemaking publication. The agency may modify the proposed rule or regulatory analysis based on the panel's recommendations. The covered agency may modify the draft proposed rule, initial regulatory flexibility analysis, or decision on whether an analysis is required based on feedback from the review panel or small entity representatives. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code, defining 'covered agency' as EPA, OSHA, and IRS, and 'small entity representative' as an entity or individual representing a small entity. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act will take effect 90 days after enactment.
